snippet: Germany’s Christian Social Union, the sister party of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s Christian Democratic Union, is embroiled in a scandal that threatens her re-election chances.
abstract: Germany’s Christian Social Union, sister party of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s Christian Democratic Union, is embroiled in a nepotism scandal in which dozens of Bavarian party members paid their spouses, children and parents to work as assistants; scandal has engulfed this economically powerful region of Bavaria and is threatening Merkel's re-election chances.

byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY and NICHOLAS KULISH

lead_paragraph: Germany’s Christian Social Union, the sister party of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s Christian Democratic Union, is embroiled in a scandal that threatens her re-election chances.

headline.seo: In Bavaria, Family Values That Merkel Could Do Without
headline.main: Nepotism in Bavarian Politics Creates a Scandal Merkel Could Do Without
headline.print_headline: Nepotism in Bavarian Politics Creates a Scandal Merkel Could Do Without
